title: SDGs-Integrated Project-Based Mathematics Learning: Design Thinking for Sustainable Future Planning

context.prior_knowledge: Proficiency in basic mathematical concepts (statistics, functions, data analysis) and the use of digital tools
context.additional_context: Real-life problem-solving projects utilizing VR technology as a supplementary tool

learning_goals: Learners can analyze and visualize the interconnectedness of the 17 SDGs through mathematical modeling.
Learners can write a proposal for a mathematics project related to the SDGs by applying the five stages of design thinking (empathize - define - ideate - prototype - test).

Learners, organized into 4-person teams, select one community sustainability issue (e.g., waste segregation efficiency or energy-saving measures), collect data using three or more methods (e.g., surveys, field measurements), and build mathematical models using linear/nonlinear functions. Based on this, they complete a PBL report (10+ pages) or presentation (15-minute duration) within a 6-month course, achieving over 80% in four of five rubric criteria.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
